title: [Large-scale] Reflective Journaling-Based Curriculum for Transformative Learning in Design Education

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of fundamental design principles and social studies curriculum foundations
context.additional_context: Learners explore uncertainty management strategies in design projects through asynchronous online environments using personal devices, strengthening self-directed learning competencies via reflective journaling.

learning_goals: Learners can recognize uncertainties arising during the design process and propose at least three internal/external strategies to overcome them.

Over a six-month course, learners will write reflective journals twice monthly, analytically describing their design identity (three core elements) and professional development (skills/attitudes/knowledge aspects) in approximately 500 characters, achieving an average of over 4 points on peer feedback and instructor evaluation (5-point scale).

Learners will recognize three complex emotions (e.g., anxiety, anticipation, frustration) arising in uncertain situations (e.g., workplace changes, social conflicts) and design at least two practical strategies (e.g., emotion journaling, goal-resetting techniques) to convert them into learning motivation, receiving over 80% positive peer feedback.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
